page.title: 02BARLOWS SCHOOL, FAZAKERLEY
page.content: {Barlows Lane C.P.} The school was built in{1912}and was called a{Council School.}The children came to school from the age of five up to the age of fourteen. The first headmaster of the school was a man called{Mr. Pegg}and the school was made from corrugated material. Later on the school was added onto and a new wing was established. Today the school has five Junior classes and four Infant classes. The school also has a Nursery department. The present headteacher of the school is{Mr.T.E.Bowen}who has been the headmaster for the past 13 years. During the last four years the school has been modernised considerably with sink units and fitted cupboards being placed in every classroom.
